channel.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
channel.description: Finally an Ex-windows user thanks why to PcLinuxOS, I Like it very much but thanks to everyone who helped me :)

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I found reactOS harder to use than most standard linux distros due to its windows ui XD

Read full topic

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ReactOS aims to achieve complete binary compatibility with both applications and device drivers meant for [b]NT and XP[/b] operating systems

Reactos has been around for a long ass time. I played with a very early version a few years ago and it wasn’t half bad for early stages, but from the screenshots on the site it’s come a long way since. It won’t be a windows beater for a while I guess, but there’s hope, maybe one day I can run Linux+Reactos and be Windows free.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:12, topic:101366”]ReactOS is coming out soon. That IS an alternative to Windows because it supports Windows programs. They have been doing a full audit of their code since February of 2006 and are now at 98.7% done with it. Should be out within the month.

www.reactos.org

The LiveCD is about 20 MB if you want to test it out. :)[/quote]

Windows 98?

Read full topic

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

ReactOS is coming out soon. That IS an alternative to Windows because it supports Windows programs. They have been doing a full audit of their code since February of 2006 and are now at 98.7% done with it. Should be out within the month.

www.reactos.org

The LiveCD is about 20 MB if you want to test it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Tribal, post:10, topic:101366”][quote author=lawl link=topic=145400.msg1397527#msg1397527 date=1180500874]

linux sucks imo, it’s a pain in the ass to actually install something

WHAT?
windows:
go to the website, download installer, run installer, restart computer

linux:
apt-get install
done.

tell me, which one is easier?
[/quote]
windows…
im just more used with windows, its user-friendly and such even though i do have to admit that installing something would be faster with linux.[/quote]

the whole windows is more user friendly argument holds virtually no merit anymore. Latest ubuntu has support for most things which can sometimes me a pain to get working on windows for begginers right off the cd.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally and Ex-Windows
item.dc:creator: @Tribal Tribal
item.description:
@Tribal wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:2, topic:101852”][quote author=Tribal link=topic=145400.msg1396211#msg1396211 date=1180487032]
linux sucks imo, it’s a pain in the ass to actually install something
[/quote]
WHAT?
windows:
go to the website, download installer, run installer, restart computer

linux:
apt-get install
done.

tell me, which one is easier?[/quote]
windows…
im just more used with windows, its user-friendly and such even though i do have to admit that installing something would be faster with linux.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:101366”]I don’t get it, what’s so good about PCLinuxOS ? Can you run exe files on it? or is it just another Linux distro?[/quote]I believe there is a package that allows you to run some .exe files as if it were Windows.
